Someone please clarify this for me:

Manuel Amago wrote:

> > it struck me why not have a self assertive code
>
> The only solution that I can see would be to make testing (or assertion)
> an integral part of the language (ala Eiffel).  This would mean that
> tests (assertions) would be an integral part of a method definition.

    What does self-assertive mean ? JUnit, the way i understand it, tests
    my class methods with static data that i expect.
    e.g. assertTrue(40, add(20, 20));

    How can i put that in my code itself ? the real data is going to be
changing.
    All i can assert within my code is that references are not null.

Thanks,
Nilesh
